results.title: Attack Force Z
results.brief_description: Hidden on a small Pacific Island is a man with a secret that could end the Second World War and the killer elite Attack Force Z is sent in to get him out… or die in the attempt.

results.title: Atonement
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Canadian Wildlife Service, George Pearson and Michael McKennirey
results.brief_description: Ten million buffalo once roamed the plains of North America but now, only a few carefully protected herds remain. The carrier pigeon, the whooping crane and other species have fallen prey to the greatest predator, man. This program shows efforts by wildlife specialists to preserve and nurture the creatures that remain in the wilderness areas. Scenes rarely photographed are included in this spellbinding documentary.

results.title: Atoms for peace (U.S.S.R.)
results.creator_credit: Moscow Popular Science Film Studio and D Bogolepov
results.brief_description: Illustrates the peaceful use of atomic energy in the USSR and shows the first atomic power plant in the USSR. The program explains the basic processes involved in nuclear fission and the safety procedures which protect workers. Demonstrates the use of isotopes in medicine, especially in cancer treatment and also the application of atomic energy in industry: improved plastics, oil exploration, detection of flaws in casting and welded seams, use of tracers in checking the condition of blast furnaces and quality control in metal production. The research potential of atomic installations is explored.

results.title: Atoms for peace (Sweden)
results.brief_description: Shows how Sweden, though it is a small country, has become a world leader in the peaceful uses of atomic energy. Examples and advantages of nuclear power generation for the production of electricity and heat and use of radioactive isotopes for industry and medicine are presented. No other credits available.

results.title: Atoms at work
results.brief_description: The production of radioactive isotopes in the atomic pile at Harwell Research Station, England. Some of the numerous uses to which the isotopes are put No other credits available.

results.title: Atoms and molecules
results.brief_description: Sir Lawrence Bragg describes and illustrates the structure of atoms and molecules, demonstrates their size and the progressive development of microscopic instruments and techniques, and performs experiments showing the wetting of oil molecules and the Brownian movement. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Atomisation
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit and Bill Mason
results.brief_description: Atomisation is defined as the breaking up of liquids into minute drops for efficient burning or economical spreading. Different methods of atomising liquids; scent spray; centrifugal spinning cup plus air blast; pressure jet. Slowed movement illustrations (150X) show how atomisation occurs. Main uses: agricultural and for burning liquid fuel. Various methods of qualitative and quantitative evaluation of spray patterns. Testing jet aircraft atomizers.

results.title: Atomic structure and correlations within the Periodic Table
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Andrew Patterson, Jr and David G. Anderson
results.brief_description: The first episode of this film looks at atomic structure and the Periodic Table, and the second episoe looks at correlations with the Periodic Table. Using a blackboard size Periodic Table from which individual elements can be removed or placed at will, this film illustrates a method of using the Periodic system to determine the electronic structure of atoms. Suitable for Upper-Secondary students.

results.title: Atomic juggernaut
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Walford Hewitson, Tom Daly and Eugene Boyko
results.brief_description: In India they call it Anushkati - the atomic juggernaut - a modern miracle brought from Canada to light an entire region. This film shows the strange procession made by the calandria, the heart of the nuclear reactor, hauled by huge diesel tractors from the seaport in India to the proposed site of the reactor, along a roadway specially prepared beforehand. Everywhere the juggernaut passed, ancient life stopped for a moment to witness the arrival of this new deity.
